Subject: INV135633 is attached
OriginalEmailBody:
West Coast Industries

Hello GRAYBAR ELECTRIC COMPANY INC,
Thank you for your order! Attached, please find your Invoice INV135633. Your material was shipped via CON-WAY, and tracking number is 330907183.



We appreciate your business!
Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns!
 Thank you,



 Accounts Receivable
 USAI

 TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 GENERAL: All orders are subject to acceptance of the Home Office of the company in New York. Title to merchandise passes to the purchaser upon delivery to the carrier (unless our own trucks) regardless of whether-or-not transportation charges are paid or allowed  by the company. All orders are accepted contingent on our ability to secure necessary materials and labor. We do not assume responsibility for incomplete or delayed execution of orders. In the case of any special equipment described by catalog numbers which  do not appear in our price guide, we reserve the right to quote and sell only to the distributor who led us to develop this design for his customer.

 TERMS: 1% 10 Days Net 30 for credit approved open accounts. There will be a $10.00 handling charge added on orders totaling les than $100.00 net. PAST DUE ACCOUNTS: SUBJECT TO A SERVICE CHARGE EQUAL TO Â½% PER MONTH, BUT IN NO EVENT HIGHER THAN PERMITTED BY  APPLICABLE LAW. In addition to such late payment service charges, costs and expenses associated with collection of past due amounts, including reasonable attorneyâ€™s fees, shall be added to the amounts past due.

 DELIVERY: All shipments F.O.B., New Windsor, NY with surface freight allowed as follows (based on selling price value of individual shipments). Overnight shipments are not allowed regardless of value and carrier account numbers must be supplied. Partial releases  or shipments processed at the customerâ€™s request will be subject to these same allowances: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx and Staten Island $3,000.00 or more East of Mississippi River $3,500.00 or more West of Mississippi River $5,000.00 or more For shipments  of $5,000.00 or more to AK or HI, freight will be allowed to the West Coast. Freight from the West Coast to the final destination will be charged. For shipments to CN: Ontario East US $3,500.00 or more Manitoba West US $5,000.00 or more CN allowances are subject  to change subject to currency fluctuation.

 IMPORTANT:
 Freight allowances apply only to the base freight charges from the carrier. Any additional or extraordinary charges are not allowed and will be invoiced. This includes, but is not limited to, the following extra charges:
 - Call before notification â€“ Early AM delivery
 - Liftgate â€“ Residential/church delivery
 - Pallet jack â€“ Re-consignment fees
 - Fuel surcharge â€“ Local difficult delivery surcharges
 These are project specific charges over which we have no control, and as such, are not incorporated in our pricing.

 SHORTAGES/DAMAGES
 I.C.C. regulations state that all claims for SHORTAGES and DAMAGES (both visible and concealed) must be entered against the carrier within 15 days from receipt of shipment. Absolutely no claim will be allowed beyond 15 days. In case of loss or damage in transit,  consignee must make all claims with delivering carrier within normal time limits established by the I.C.C. We suggest immediate inspection of goods when received, and prompt filing of claims in case of breakage.

 RETURNS POLICY: All sales are final. However, in some cases returns may be allowed within 90 days after original shipment date. No products will be accepted for return without our written approval and unless accompanied by a properly authorized written â€˜Return  Authorization Requestâ€™ initiated by an appropriate USAI Employee. Return freight must be pre-paid. For non-special or non-custom products accepted for return a credit will be issued at the price invoiced, from which will be deducted the expense for return  transportation (if not prepaid) and a minimum restocking charge of 50% of the invoice value. Material returned without authorization will be accepted with no credit issued. Products appropriately returned for defects in material and workmanship, or error in  shipment will be accepted for full credit without service charge. Special or custom-made products including units that are modified from standard units cannot be returned for credit. Orders with an invoice value of less than $100.00 are not subject to return.

 WARRANTY AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY: USAI products, when properly installed and under normal conditions of use, are warranted to our customers only to be free from defects in material and workmanship at the time of shipment. All warranty claims must be asserted within  one year from the date of shipment of the subject items; thereafter warranty claims will not be honored. Customerâ€™s sole remedy for a warranty claim or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product if it is shown to have been defective  in material or workmanship at the time of shipment. USAIâ€™s sole and maximum liability for a defective product shall never exceed the cost of the subject product. Except for such warranty and exclusive remedy as stated, (and the express warranty of title),  we disclaim all other warranties, whether expressed or implied and specifically disclaim the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall we be liable to customer in warranty, contract negligence, strict liability  or otherwise, for any damages, whether incidental or consequential which are alleged to be caused by one or more of our products, beyond the cost to the customer of the subject product or products. Therefore, the customerâ€™s sole and exclusive remedy against  us for breach of warranty, breach of contract, or in negligence or in strict liability or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product at our option (excluding installation and removal charges which shall not be our liability)  or, if we choose, to refund the purchase price. Warranty does not pass to the purchaser until payment is received in full. In no case does our warranty and exclusive remedy extend to anybody other than our customers. Our customers are not authorized to extend  warranties or remedies on our behalf to anyone. Such unauthorized extensions of warranties or remedies by the customer shall remain the customerâ€™s responsibility. Customer is responsible for determining the suitability of our products for customerâ€™s use or  resale, or for incorporating them into objects or for application which customer designs, assembles, constructs or manufactures. All HID and fluorescent ballasts, dimming ballasts, and energy ballasts are covered under separate manufacturer warranties and  subject to their own warranty policies. TRANSFORMER NOISE: We accept no responsibility for transformer noise when used with dimming systems ERRORS: While great care is expended in the preparation of all printed literature, we will not be responsible for clerical  or typographical errors. CHANGES IN SPECIFICATIONS: USAI, LLC reserves the right to make engineering or dimensional changes with no prior notification and will not be obligated to modify fixtures manufactured prior to these changes. Please check our website  www.usailighting.com for any changes in spefication which may have been made. CANCELLATION: If standard products are cancelled within 24 hrs of order receipt and the order has not shipped there is no charge. If standard products are cancelled after 24 hrs  of receipt of order, a 25% fee will apply. Modified or custom orders are not subject to cancellation.

 Electronic Privacy Notice: This email, and any attachments, contains information that is, or may be, covered by electronic communications privacy laws, and is also confidential and proprietary in nature. If you are not the intended recipient, please be advised  that you are legally prohibited from retaining, using, copying, distributing, or otherwise disclosing this information in any manner. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by telephone or email, and then immediately  destroy the original communication. Thank you for your cooperation.

Subject: *** tax exempt resale certification needed ***
OriginalEmailBody:
Received: 10:59 AM From: allison.carlsen@1sae.com To: saps@graybar.com CC:  Subject: *** tax exempt resale certification needed ***
Good morning,


We received your CC payment of 1918.55 on 05/26/2020 and thankÂ you for your payment.Â  We noticed that several of the invoices were paid short ( tax excluded from payment )


We do need a tax exempt resale certificate to stop charging you tax on your orders and to credit the invoices that have been paid short.


I have attached a list of all states we are required to collect sales tax in.Â  Â If you ship to any of the states noted below you must submitÂ a resale cert or we will have to charge tax.


We are registered to collect sales tax in the following states:
CA, GA, IL, IN, KY, MD, MA, MI, NV, NJ, NY, NC, OH, SC, TX, VA, WA, & WI



I look forward to hearing from you soon.


Thank you

















Allison CarlsenÂ |Â Space Age Electronics
58 Chocksett Road, Sterling, MA 01564 |Â 1.978.212.1335Â |Â www.1sae.com

Subject: W.A.C Lighting Electronic Invoice Notification
OriginalEmailBody: From: SHONTERIA@waclighting.com Sent: 7:27 AM To: SAPS@graybar.com CC:  Subject: W.A.C Lighting Electronic Invoice Notification  Dear Valued Customer, Your order has been shipped. Attached is a copy of your electronic invoice, please review it for details. NEW PRICE LIST EFFECTIVE March 2, 2020 We would like to bring to your attention that W.A.C. Lighting has a new price list effective March 2, 2020. The new price list has been faxed/mailed to our customers. Please make sure you update your internal records for our new pricing. In order to view the attachment, you must have Adobe Acrobat Reader installed on your computer. If you do not have Acrobat Reader, please click on the following link to install a free copy www.adobe.com. Your continued patronage is appreciated, and we value the opportunity to provide you with superior customer service. If you are looking for detailed information on your account, including invoices, credits, payment information, order status or simply to check stock availability, please visit our website at www.waclighting.com. Should you have any questions or require log in information, please contact our customer service representatives who are available to assist you from 8 AM until 6 PM EST, and can be reached by calling 800-526-2588 and selecting Option 2. For future orders, please email us at orderentry@waclighting.com or you may fax them to 800-526-2585. If you would like to make a payment or discuss your account balance, please call our Accounting Department at 800-526-2588 and select Option 3. To ensure proper credit to your account, all payments should be made to the remit address shown on your invoice. Please do not reply to this email. We thank you for your business and for being a part of saving our environment. Regards, W.A.C Lighting

Subject: Airgas Invoicing  (1 of 1)
OriginalEmailBody: From: statementautomation@carolina.sourcelink.com Sent: 11:19 PM To: saps@graybar.com;statementautomation@sourcelink.com CC:  Subject: Airgas Invoicing  (1 of 1)  This message is an invoice from AIRGAS USA, LLC for goods or services purchased by your organization. If you experience any problems or difficulties with this communication, please contact Customer Service at 216-642-1500; (fax) 216-642-6622; or ndiv.sourcelink.errors@airgas.com. Please provide account number. Do not reply to the sender of this message. In order to view or print this invoice, you must have Adobe Acrobat Reader, which is available as a free download from Adobe. Click on the following link: http://www.adobe.com/products/acrobat/readstep.html We appreciate your business. Disclosure Terms of Sale: Each sale of Goods or services by an Airgas company is and shall be governed by the terms and conditions on this Disclosure, the Terms of Sale affixed to the Account Application (if one has been completed), and the Terms of Sale found at http://www.airgas.com/terms-of-sale (collectively the "Terms of Sale"). Each Contract for the sale of Goods or services between Seller and Buyer ("Contract") shall include these Terms of Sale, together with any other material describing the Goods or services being sold, their price, delivery terms, and all other special provisions. "Goods" refers to any items of tangible personal property described in any Contract or otherwise provided by Seller to Buyer. Notice Regarding Cylinder Rentals/Leases and Responsibility: This document shows the total number of cylinders charged to Buyer (i.e., cylinders which Seller has rented or leased to Buyer, and which Buyer has not returned) according to Seller's records as of the month ending date shown. The number of cylinders thus charged to Buyer shall be considered correct for all contractual purposes between Buyer and Seller, unless Buyer reports to Seller in writing any errors Buyer claims within 60 days after the date hereof. Buyer agrees to continue to pay rent on all cylinders charged to Buyer until Buyer has either (i) returned such cylinders to Seller in good working order or (ii) pays Seller the replacement cost thereof. Refrigerant Cylinder Returns/Deposit. Refillable refrigerant cylinders shall remain the property of Airgas or its third-party vendors. Such cylinders shall not be used by Customer for purposes other than the storage of gas products purchased from Airgas or the return and reclamation of certain gases (e.g., refrigerants). Each refillable cylinder will be subject to a cylinder deposit fee, as established by Airgas from time to time. Airgas will refund the deposit fee when the Customer returns the refrigerant cylinder unless the cylinder's condition is deemed to be unfit for reuse, as determined by Airgas, which determination shall be irrefutable sixty days after the cylinder was returned. Warranty: All products, other items of sale, cylinders and other containers furnished by an Airgas company shall conform to the description thereof published by the manufacturer at the time of sale and will meet Seller's purity specifications for all gas products. SELLER SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY OTHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED STANDARDS, GUARANTEES, OR WARRANTIES, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NON- INFRINGEMENT AND ANY WARRANTIES THAT MAY BE ALLEGED TO ARISE AS A RESULT OF CUSTOM OR USAGE. Limitation of Liability: SELLER SHALL BE LIABLE ONLY FOR THE REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF DEFECTIVE GAS CYLINDERS AND PRODUCTS, INCLUDING THE REPLACEMENT OF GASES THAT DO NOT MEET ITS PURITY SPECIFICATIONS WITH GASES THAT DO MEET SUCH SPECIFICATIONS. BUYER KNOWINGLY AND FULLY ASSUMES THE RISKS OF TRANSPORTING AND USING COMPRESSED GASES. SELLER SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT (EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED HEREIN), INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL AND/OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, ARISING OR ALLEGED TO ARISE OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH ITS PERFORMANCE OF ANY OBLIGATIONS ORANY PRODUCT, OTHER ITEMS OF SALE, OR EQUIPMENT SOLD OR LEASED BY SELLER, WHETHER SUCH DAMAGE RESULTS FROM ANY NEGLIGENT ACT OR OMISSION OR IS RELATED TO STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE. Terms of Payment: Unless otherwise specified in a Contract, Buyer shall make payment in full within 30 days after the date of Seller's invoice. A late payment charge of 1.5% on the unpaid, past due balance, will be assessed monthly (minimum two dollars ($2.00), or the maximum lawful rate allowable in the state where the Goods are delivered, whichever is less. Surcharges: Upon notice and receipt of underlying documentation, Buyer shall pay to Seller a surcharge in the event of any extraordinary or emergency increases in the cost of (a) power and/or raw materials used in the production of Products and/or (b) fuel. Title to Equipment: Title to all rental equipment shall remain in Seller's name. Buyer shall not cover, modify, remove or otherwise disturb any identification or other indicia of Seller's ownership on any rental equipment. Taxes: Any taxes imposed by federal, state, or other governmental authority on the sale, use or possession of Goods, or the sale or performance of services by an Airgas company, shall be paid by Buyer in addition to the purchase price. Itemized Charges: The total amount due from the Buyer may include various itemized charges, including: charges for the handling of hazardous materials and for compliance with laws and regulations concerning hazardous materials; charges for handling, delivery and shipping; and/or charges for energy or fuel. None of the charges represent a tax or fee paid to or imposed by any government authority, and all of the charges are retained by the Seller. The Seller has not specifically quantified the relationship between the charges and the actual costs associated with the charges, which can vary by product, service, time and place, among other things. Government Contracts: Certain Airgas companies are U.S. government contractors and subcontractors and are subject to and adhere to the requirements of federal laws, executive orders, and attendant rules and regulations, specifically Executive Order No. 11246, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and the Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, all as amended. Thank you for your recent order from TMB.Â  We are pleased to tell you that we have processed shipments for your order(s). For your reference, please see the attached invoice(s) in Adobe Acrobat** format. 
Your shipping information is shown below.Â  If your order shipped via FEDEX or UPS, please use the links for tracking info.Â  If tracking links do not appear below, please check the comment section of the attached invoice(s) for tracking  or shipping information.Â

We are confident that you will be happy with your order, however if for any reason you are not satisfied, our Customer Service department will gladly assist you. They can be reached by e-mail at customerservice@tmb.com.
Be sure to visit our Web site http://www.tmb.com to keep up with the latest information on TMB and the products we carry!

The location originating that return shipment states that the material involved in the chargeback was in fact included in the shipment
Â

And if it was signed for with exception?
Was any notification of this discrepancy sent to anyone at Graybar previous to this May dated chargeback?
Â 
At this time,
we must put this chargeback into Disputed Status pending receipt of more substantive information on this ..

From: CorpFRTAdmin [mailto:CorpFRTAdmin@graybar.com]
 Sent: Wednesday, February 05, 2020 11:48 AM
 To: Donna Carmichael
 Subject: RE: CB 5600068080 2019
Â 
Donna-
Â 
The reason this was deducted was due to non-compliance. Graybar provided shipping instructions that were not followed. Please see shipping instructions below:

1. For shipments less than 150 lbs. Ship UPS Collect: Billing Option- Bill Receiver. Graybar PO# must be entered in UPS Reference 1 or 2.
2.For shipments over 150 lbs. or those items exceeding UPS size limitations. If destined for a Graybar location ship LTL Collect. If destined for a non-Graybar location ship 3rd party billing to the  Graybar branch originating the purchase order using selected carriers on Graybar's Routing Guide. Contact BlueGrace Logistics for any routing guide questions.
3. For shipments over 7,500 lbs. or occupies 750 cubic feet or 7 pallet spaces, call for a truckload routing: BlueGrace Logistics at  1-813-980-0007 orgraybar@mybluegrace.com

 Can you please advise if Lumax Lighting was instructed to ship other than what is outlined above? If so, please provide supporting documentation. Although you didnâ€™t ship UPS, you had the ability to ship LTL collect.

Subject: FedEx SmartPost and Oversize Temporary Surcharges
OriginalEmailBody:
FedEx         FedEx is an essential business keeping commerce moving and delivering critical shipments to homes during the COVID-19 crisis.

         As the impact of the virus continues to generate a surge in residential deliveries and has also generated a surge in oversize, hard-to-handle packages, we have experienced increased operating costs across our network.

         We wanted to make you aware that we are implementing temporary surcharges on all U.S. domestic Oversize packages and on all FedEx SmartPost packages beginning June 8 until further notice. Details of the surcharges can be foundhere. These surcharges will allow us to continue providing our customers with strong levels of service during this time.

         We appreciate your trust in FedEx as we focus on serving you.
Â This email has been sent tosaps@graybar.com.

 Â©2020 FedEx. The content of this message is protected by copyright and trademark laws under U.S. and international law. Review ourprivacy policy. All rights reserved.

View as webpage

Subject: INV135926 is attached
OriginalEmailBody:
West Coast Industries

Hello GRAYBAR ELECTRIC COMPANY INC,
Thank you for your order! Attached, please find your Invoice INV135926. Your material was shipped via CON-WAY, and tracking number is 330907404.



We appreciate your business!
Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns!
 Thank you,



 Accounts Receivable
 USAI

 TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 GENERAL: All orders are subject to acceptance of the Home Office of the company in New York. Title to merchandise passes to the purchaser upon delivery to the carrier (unless our own trucks) regardless of whether-or-not transportation charges are paid or allowed  by the company. All orders are accepted contingent on our ability to secure necessary materials and labor. We do not assume responsibility for incomplete or delayed execution of orders. In the case of any special equipment described by catalog numbers which  do not appear in our price guide, we reserve the right to quote and sell only to the distributor who led us to develop this design for his customer.

 TERMS: 1% 10 Days Net 30 for credit approved open accounts. There will be a $10.00 handling charge added on orders totaling les than $100.00 net. PAST DUE ACCOUNTS: SUBJECT TO A SERVICE CHARGE EQUAL TO Â½% PER MONTH, BUT IN NO EVENT HIGHER THAN PERMITTED BY  APPLICABLE LAW. In addition to such late payment service charges, costs and expenses associated with collection of past due amounts, including reasonable attorneyâ€™s fees, shall be added to the amounts past due.

 DELIVERY: All shipments F.O.B., New Windsor, NY with surface freight allowed as follows (based on selling price value of individual shipments). Overnight shipments are not allowed regardless of value and carrier account numbers must be supplied. Partial releases  or shipments processed at the customerâ€™s request will be subject to these same allowances: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx and Staten Island $3,000.00 or more East of Mississippi River $3,500.00 or more West of Mississippi River $5,000.00 or more For shipments  of $5,000.00 or more to AK or HI, freight will be allowed to the West Coast. Freight from the West Coast to the final destination will be charged. For shipments to CN: Ontario East US $3,500.00 or more Manitoba West US $5,000.00 or more CN allowances are subject  to change subject to currency fluctuation.

 IMPORTANT:
 Freight allowances apply only to the base freight charges from the carrier. Any additional or extraordinary charges are not allowed and will be invoiced. This includes, but is not limited to, the following extra charges:
 - Call before notification â€“ Early AM delivery
 - Liftgate â€“ Residential/church delivery
 - Pallet jack â€“ Re-consignment fees
 - Fuel surcharge â€“ Local difficult delivery surcharges
 These are project specific charges over which we have no control, and as such, are not incorporated in our pricing.

 SHORTAGES/DAMAGES
 I.C.C. regulations state that all claims for SHORTAGES and DAMAGES (both visible and concealed) must be entered against the carrier within 15 days from receipt of shipment. Absolutely no claim will be allowed beyond 15 days. In case of loss or damage in transit,  consignee must make all claims with delivering carrier within normal time limits established by the I.C.C. We suggest immediate inspection of goods when received, and prompt filing of claims in case of breakage.

 RETURNS POLICY: All sales are final. However, in some cases returns may be allowed within 90 days after original shipment date. No products will be accepted for return without our written approval and unless accompanied by a properly authorized written â€˜Return  Authorization Requestâ€™ initiated by an appropriate USAI Employee. Return freight must be pre-paid. For non-special or non-custom products accepted for return a credit will be issued at the price invoiced, from which will be deducted the expense for return  transportation (if not prepaid) and a minimum restocking charge of 50% of the invoice value. Material returned without authorization will be accepted with no credit issued. Products appropriately returned for defects in material and workmanship, or error in  shipment will be accepted for full credit without service charge. Special or custom-made products including units that are modified from standard units cannot be returned for credit. Orders with an invoice value of less than $100.00 are not subject to return.

 WARRANTY AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY: USAI products, when properly installed and under normal conditions of use, are warranted to our customers only to be free from defects in material and workmanship at the time of shipment. All warranty claims must be asserted within  one year from the date of shipment of the subject items; thereafter warranty claims will not be honored. Customerâ€™s sole remedy for a warranty claim or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product if it is shown to have been defective  in material or workmanship at the time of shipment. USAIâ€™s sole and maximum liability for a defective product shall never exceed the cost of the subject product. Except for such warranty and exclusive remedy as stated, (and the express warranty of title),  we disclaim all other warranties, whether expressed or implied and specifically disclaim the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall we be liable to customer in warranty, contract negligence, strict liability  or otherwise, for any damages, whether incidental or consequential which are alleged to be caused by one or more of our products, beyond the cost to the customer of the subject product or products. Therefore, the customerâ€™s sole and exclusive remedy against  us for breach of warranty, breach of contract, or in negligence or in strict liability or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product at our option (excluding installation and removal charges which shall not be our liability)  or, if we choose, to refund the purchase price. Warranty does not pass to the purchaser until payment is received in full. In no case does our warranty and exclusive remedy extend to anybody other than our customers. Our customers are not authorized to extend  warranties or remedies on our behalf to anyone. Such unauthorized extensions of warranties or remedies by the customer shall remain the customerâ€™s responsibility. Customer is responsible for determining the suitability of our products for customerâ€™s use or  resale, or for incorporating them into objects or for application which customer designs, assembles, constructs or manufactures. All HID and fluorescent ballasts, dimming ballasts, and energy ballasts are covered under separate manufacturer warranties and  subject to their own warranty policies. TRANSFORMER NOISE: We accept no responsibility for transformer noise when used with dimming systems ERRORS: While great care is expended in the preparation of all printed literature, we will not be responsible for clerical  or typographical errors. CHANGES IN SPECIFICATIONS: USAI, LLC reserves the right to make engineering or dimensional changes with no prior notification and will not be obligated to modify fixtures manufactured prior to these changes. Please check our website  www.usailighting.com for any changes in spefication which may have been made. CANCELLATION: If standard products are cancelled within 24 hrs of order receipt and the order has not shipped there is no charge. If standard products are cancelled after 24 hrs  of receipt of order, a 25% fee will apply. Modified or custom orders are not subject to cancellation.

 Electronic Privacy Notice: This email, and any attachments, contains information that is, or may be, covered by electronic communications privacy laws, and is also confidential and proprietary in nature. If you are not the intended recipient, please be advised  that you are legally prohibited from retaining, using, copying, distributing, or otherwise disclosing this information in any manner. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by telephone or email, and then immediately  destroy the original communication. Thank you for your cooperation.

Subject: INV135967 is attached
OriginalEmailBody:
West Coast Industries

Hello GRAYBAR ELECTRIC COMPANY INC,
Thank you for your order! Attached, please find your Invoice INV135967. Your material was shipped via UPS GROUND, and tracking number is 1Z6X79280371570212.



We appreciate your business!
Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns!
 Thank you,



 Accounts Receivable
 USAI

 TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 GENERAL: All orders are subject to acceptance of the Home Office of the company in New York. Title to merchandise passes to the purchaser upon delivery to the carrier (unless our own trucks) regardless of whether-or-not transportation charges are paid or allowed  by the company. All orders are accepted contingent on our ability to secure necessary materials and labor. We do not assume responsibility for incomplete or delayed execution of orders. In the case of any special equipment described by catalog numbers which  do not appear in our price guide, we reserve the right to quote and sell only to the distributor who led us to develop this design for his customer.

 TERMS: 1% 10 Days Net 30 for credit approved open accounts. There will be a $10.00 handling charge added on orders totaling les than $100.00 net. PAST DUE ACCOUNTS: SUBJECT TO A SERVICE CHARGE EQUAL TO Â½% PER MONTH, BUT IN NO EVENT HIGHER THAN PERMITTED BY  APPLICABLE LAW. In addition to such late payment service charges, costs and expenses associated with collection of past due amounts, including reasonable attorneyâ€™s fees, shall be added to the amounts past due.

 DELIVERY: All shipments F.O.B., New Windsor, NY with surface freight allowed as follows (based on selling price value of individual shipments). Overnight shipments are not allowed regardless of value and carrier account numbers must be supplied. Partial releases  or shipments processed at the customerâ€™s request will be subject to these same allowances: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx and Staten Island $3,000.00 or more East of Mississippi River $3,500.00 or more West of Mississippi River $5,000.00 or more For shipments  of $5,000.00 or more to AK or HI, freight will be allowed to the West Coast. Freight from the West Coast to the final destination will be charged. For shipments to CN: Ontario East US $3,500.00 or more Manitoba West US $5,000.00 or more CN allowances are subject  to change subject to currency fluctuation.

 IMPORTANT:
 Freight allowances apply only to the base freight charges from the carrier. Any additional or extraordinary charges are not allowed and will be invoiced. This includes, but is not limited to, the following extra charges:
 - Call before notification â€“ Early AM delivery
 - Liftgate â€“ Residential/church delivery
 - Pallet jack â€“ Re-consignment fees
 - Fuel surcharge â€“ Local difficult delivery surcharges
 These are project specific charges over which we have no control, and as such, are not incorporated in our pricing.

 SHORTAGES/DAMAGES
 I.C.C. regulations state that all claims for SHORTAGES and DAMAGES (both visible and concealed) must be entered against the carrier within 15 days from receipt of shipment. Absolutely no claim will be allowed beyond 15 days. In case of loss or damage in transit,  consignee must make all claims with delivering carrier within normal time limits established by the I.C.C. We suggest immediate inspection of goods when received, and prompt filing of claims in case of breakage.

 RETURNS POLICY: All sales are final. However, in some cases returns may be allowed within 90 days after original shipment date. No products will be accepted for return without our written approval and unless accompanied by a properly authorized written â€˜Return  Authorization Requestâ€™ initiated by an appropriate USAI Employee. Return freight must be pre-paid. For non-special or non-custom products accepted for return a credit will be issued at the price invoiced, from which will be deducted the expense for return  transportation (if not prepaid) and a minimum restocking charge of 50% of the invoice value. Material returned without authorization will be accepted with no credit issued. Products appropriately returned for defects in material and workmanship, or error in  shipment will be accepted for full credit without service charge. Special or custom-made products including units that are modified from standard units cannot be returned for credit. Orders with an invoice value of less than $100.00 are not subject to return.

 WARRANTY AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY: USAI products, when properly installed and under normal conditions of use, are warranted to our customers only to be free from defects in material and workmanship at the time of shipment. All warranty claims must be asserted within  one year from the date of shipment of the subject items; thereafter warranty claims will not be honored. Customerâ€™s sole remedy for a warranty claim or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product if it is shown to have been defective  in material or workmanship at the time of shipment. USAIâ€™s sole and maximum liability for a defective product shall never exceed the cost of the subject product. Except for such warranty and exclusive remedy as stated, (and the express warranty of title),  we disclaim all other warranties, whether expressed or implied and specifically disclaim the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall we be liable to customer in warranty, contract negligence, strict liability  or otherwise, for any damages, whether incidental or consequential which are alleged to be caused by one or more of our products, beyond the cost to the customer of the subject product or products. Therefore, the customerâ€™s sole and exclusive remedy against  us for breach of warranty, breach of contract, or in negligence or in strict liability or otherwise shall be limited to repair or replacement of the subject product at our option (excluding installation and removal charges which shall not be our liability)  or, if we choose, to refund the purchase price. Warranty does not pass to the purchaser until payment is received in full. In no case does our warranty and exclusive remedy extend to anybody other than our customers. Our customers are not authorized to extend  warranties or remedies on our behalf to anyone. Such unauthorized extensions of warranties or remedies by the customer shall remain the customerâ€™s responsibility. Customer is responsible for determining the suitability of our products for customerâ€™s use or  resale, or for incorporating them into objects or for application which customer designs, assembles, constructs or manufactures. All HID and fluorescent ballasts, dimming ballasts, and energy ballasts are covered under separate manufacturer warranties and  subject to their own warranty policies. TRANSFORMER NOISE: We accept no responsibility for transformer noise when used with dimming systems ERRORS: While great care is expended in the preparation of all printed literature, we will not be responsible for clerical  or typographical errors. CHANGES IN SPECIFICATIONS: USAI, LLC reserves the right to make engineering or dimensional changes with no prior notification and will not be obligated to modify fixtures manufactured prior to these changes. Please check our website  www.usailighting.com for any changes in spefication which may have been made. CANCELLATION: If standard products are cancelled within 24 hrs of order receipt and the order has not shipped there is no charge. If standard products are cancelled after 24 hrs  of receipt of order, a 25% fee will apply. Modified or custom orders are not subject to cancellation.

 Electronic Privacy Notice: This email, and any attachments, contains information that is, or may be, covered by electronic communications privacy laws, and is also confidential and proprietary in nature. If you are not the intended recipient, please be advised  that you are legally prohibited from retaining, using, copying, distributing, or otherwise disclosing this information in any manner. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by telephone or email, and then immediately  destroy the original communication. Thank you for your cooperation.
